snippet: Separatists in Donetsk and Slovyansk cast early ballots in support of local autonomy, but the U.S. and Europe condemned the vote and said they would not recognize the results.
abstract: Separatists in Ukraine's eastern provinces of Donetsk and Luhansk hold plebiscites on whether to follow Crimea in seeking to be annexed by Russia; almost all ballots are cast in favor of secession, as opponents chose to stay away from polls; United States, many European nations and government in Kiev condemn referendums, saying they were illegal and likely to worsen violence.

byline.contributor: Noah Sneider and C. J. Chivers contributed reporting from Slovyansk, Ukraine, and David M. Herszenhorn from Kiev.

lead_paragraph: Separatists in Donetsk and Slovyansk cast early ballots in support of local autonomy, but the U.S. and Europe condemned the vote and said they would not recognize the results.

headline.main: Ukraine Vote on Separation Held in Chaos
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Vote on Separation Held in Chaos
